titles.en: Chapter 23 – Merits of looking at the Kabah
Chapter 23 – Merits of looking at the Kabah

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ جَمِيعاً عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ عُمَرَ بْنِ أُذَيْنَةَ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ قَالَ كُنْتُ قَاعِداً إِلَى جَنْبِ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) وَ هُوَ مُحْتَبٍ مُسْتَقْبِلُ الْكَعْبَةِ فَقَالَ أَمَا إِنَّ النَّظَرَ إِلَيْهَا عِبَادَةٌ فَجَاءَهُ رَجُلٌ مِنْ بَجِيلَةَ يُقَالُ لَهُ عَاصِمُ بْنُ عُمَرَ فَقَالَ لِأَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) إِنَّ كَعْبَ الْأَحْبَارِ كَانَ يَقُولُ إِنَّ الْكَعْبَةَ تَسْجُدُ لِبَيْتِ الْمَقْدِسِ فِي كُلِّ غَدَاةٍ فَقَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) فَمَا تَقُولُ فِيمَا قَالَ كَعْبٌ فَقَالَ صَدَقَ الْقَوْلُ مَا قَالَ كَعْبٌ فَقَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) كَذَبْتَ وَ كَذَبَ كَعْبُ الْأَحْبَارِ مَعَكَ وَ غَضِبَ قَالَ زُرَارَةُ مَا رَأَيْتُهُ اسْتَقْبَلَ أَحَداً بِقَوْلِ كَذَبْتَ غَيْرَهُ ثُمَّ قَالَ مَا خَلَقَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ بُقْعَةً فِي الْأَرْضِ أَحَبَّ إِلَيْهِ مِنْهَا ثُمَّ أَوْمَأَ بِيَدِهِ نَحْوَ الْكَعْبَةِ وَ لَا أَكْرَمَ عَلَى اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ مِنْهَا لَهَا حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ الْأَشْهُرَ الْحُرُمَ فِي كِتَابِهِ يَوْمَ خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَ الْأَرْضَ ثَلَاثَةٌ مُتَوَالِيَةٌ لِلْحَجِّ شَوَّالٌ وَ ذُو الْقَعْدَةِ وَ ذُو الْحِجَّةِ وَ شَهْرٌ مُفْرَدٌ لِلْعُمْرَةِ وَ هُوَ رَجَبٌ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, and Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Al Fazl Bin Shazan, altogether from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Umar Bin Azina, from Zurara who said, 
‘I was seated by the side of Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> and he<sup>asws</sup> was Mohtab (Sitting with arms around the knees covered) facing the Kabah. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘But, looking at the Kabah is (an act of) worship’. So a man from Bajeela called Aasim Bin Umar came over, so he said to Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>, ‘Ka’ab Al-Ahbaar was saying that the Kabah prostrates to Bayt Al-Maqdis during every morning’. So Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘So what are you saying regarding what Ka’ab said?’ So he said, ‘He spoke the truth. The word (going around) is what Ka’ab said’. So Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘You lied, and Ka’ab Al-Ahbar lied along with you’, and (the Imam<sup>asws</sup>) was angered.
Zurara said, ‘I have not seen him<sup>asws</sup> facing anyone by saying: ‘You lied!’ apart from him. Then he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic has not Created a spot in the earth more Beloved to Him<sup>azwj</sup>, than it’. Then he<sup>asws</sup> gestured with his<sup>asws</sup> hand towards the Kabah, (and said): ‘Nor is anything more Prestigious to Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic than it. For it, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Sanctified the months in His<sup>azwj</sup> Book the day He<sup>azwj</sup> Created the skies and the earth. Three are consecutive for the Hajj – Shawwal, and Zul Qadah, and Zul Hijja, and a month separate for the Umra, and it is Rajab’.

verses.text: وَ بِهَذَا الْإِسْنَادِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِنَّ لِلَّهِ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى حَوْلَ الْكَعْبَةِ عِشْرِينَ وَ مِائَةَ رَحْمَةٍ مِنْهَا سِتُّونَ لِلطَّائِفِينَ وَ أَرْبَعُونَ لِلْمُصَلِّينَ وَ عِشْرُونَ لِلنَّاظِرِينَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
And by this chain, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Muawiya Bin Ammar, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Blessed and High has one hundred and twenty Mercies around the Kabah. From these, sixty are for the circumambulators, and forty for the Praying ones, and twenty for the beholders’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ الْخَزَّازِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِنَّ لِلْكَعْبَةِ لَلَحْظَةً فِي كُلِّ يَوْمٍ يُغْفَرُ لِمَنْ طَافَ بِهَا أَوْ حَنَّ قَلْبُهُ إِلَيْهَا أَوْ حَبَسَهُ عَنْهَا عُذْرٌ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Abu Abdullah Al Khazzaz, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘For the Kabah there is a moment during every day. It Forgives the one who circumambulates by it, or inclines his heart towards it, or an excuse which withhold him from it’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنِ ابْنِ رِبَاطٍ عَنْ سَيْفٍ التَّمَّارِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَنْ نَظَرَ إِلَى الْكَعْبَةِ لَمْ يَزَلْ تُكْتَبُ لَهُ حَسَنَةٌ وَ تُمْحَى عَنْهُ سَيِّئَةٌ حَتَّى يَنْصَرِفَ بِبَصَرِهِ عَنْهَا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ibn Mahboub, from Al Hassan Bin Ali, from Ibn Rabat, from Sayf Al Tammar, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The one who looks at the Kabah, the writing of the Rewards for him and the deletion of sins would not cease from it, until he turns his eyesight away from it’.

verses.text:
عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ النَّظَرُ إِلَى الْكَعْبَةِ عِبَادَةٌ وَ النَّظَرُ إِلَى الْوَالِدَيْنِ عِبَادَةٌ وَ النَّظَرُ إِلَى الْإِمَامِ عِبَادَةٌ 
وَ قَالَ مَنْ نَظَرَ إِلَى الْكَعْبَةِ كُتِبَتْ لَهُ حَسَنَةٌ وَ مُحِيَتْ عَنْهُ عَشْرُ سَيِّئَاتٍ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Hammad Bin Isa, from Hareyz, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The looking towards the Kabah is (an act of) worship, and the looking towards the parents is (an act of) worship, and the looking at the Imam<sup>asws</sup> is (an act of) worship’. 
And he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The one who looks towards the Kabah, one good deed is written for him and ten sins are deleted from him’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَنْ نَظَرَ إِلَى الْكَعْبَةِ بِمَعْرِفَةٍ فَعَرَفَ مِنْ حَقِّنَا وَ حُرْمَتِنَا مِثْلَ الَّذِي عَرَفَ مِنْ حَقِّهَا وَ حُرْمَتِهَا غَفَرَ اللَّهُ لَهُ ذُنُوبَهُ وَ كَفَاهُ هَمَّ الدُّنْيَا وَ الْآخِرَةِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Ali Bin Abdul Aziz, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The one who looks at the Kabah with an understanding, so he recognises from our<sup>asws</sup> rights, and our<sup>asws</sup> sanctity, is like the one who recognises from it (Kabah’s) rights, and its Sanctity, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> would Forgive for him his sins, and Suffice him for the concerns of the world and the Hereafter’.
